DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate the association between nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) by computed tomography (CT) scan and coronary artery disease (CAD) measured by the calcium (CAC) score among HIV-infected persons.
DOC.brief_title: Coronary Artery Disease and Its Association With Liver Steatosis Among HIV-Infected Persons
DOC.criteria: HIV patients who participated in our previous Liver Study, conducted at NMCSD, and HIV patients who did not participate in the Liver Study. Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding will be excluded.
